description.narrative: Continue work with the dioceses and their congregations to develop disaster preparedness plans and ministry, with a goal of at least 20 congregations creating new or updated preparedness plans. Work with Diocesan, Episcopal Relief & Development, and Episcopal News Service communications staff to continue efforts to "tell the story" of New Jersey's Sandy recovery. Strengthen and support expansion of parish ministry to support response and recovery capacity. Continue use of the Episcopal Asset Map to gather and present data on ministry assets throughout the Diocese. In partnership with Catholic Charities and Diocese of Camden, support continued Disaster Case Management capacity through Mar 2016. Provide continued direct assistance to meet the unmet needs of up to 20 households/80 individuals in Atlantic, Cape May, Monmouth, and Ocean Counties and neighboring areas, through June 2016. In partnership with the Tuckerton Ministerium and A Future With Hope (UMCOR) assist in the reconstruction of five homes by providing direct and volunteer support serving 20 persons and providing volunteer opportunities for over 50 persons. Continue advocacy for survivors by continuing discussions and collaboration with Federal, State, and Local Government agencies, In partnership with A Future With Hope (UMCOR), St. Bernard’s Project, Affordable Housing Alliance of Monmouth County, Northeast Habitat for Humanity, and Ocean County Long Term Recovery Group; construct or reconstruct 5 households (2 households each in Monmouth and Ocean Counties, 1 household in Atlantic County).,Support the feeding program at St. Mark's, Keansburg, through direct funding to meet the needs of 200 people. Continue collaboration and cooperation with VOAD partners, including Presbyterian Disaster Assistance, UMCOR, Lutheran Disaster Response, Islamic Circle, Jewish Federation, Rebuilding Together, Church World Services, World Renew, Salvation American Red Cross, United Way, and others, to coordinate state and regional recovery efforts. Continue to seek collaborative opportunities to fund New Jersey's recovery efforts.
Hurricane Sandy recovery in the Diocese of New Jersey for 2016

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
